title: SURRENDER IN ARAM???
body:
What is it with Summoner's who surrender during Aram games with at least 2 towers left?  Haven't they ever won a 'push' from behind?
How many games have I seen won from less than Half-life left on the Nexus, I hear you ask?  Well a lot more than you would think with a lot of dedicated _Abyss workers_ styling their craft for the LATE GAME.  How inconsiderate of the Juniors!

The points are in the late-game... masteries (S's) can be earnt there, too!
{{champion:420}}

replies.body:
I may speak the language of surrender (French), but I'm Australian.

We go down in the fight and not bitch out.

Well aram is a casual mode, if people surrender, most of the team obviously aren't having fun.
On the flip side, I hate surrenders, every game is winnable as long as the nexus isn't down. I've lost tons of game bc no one went after the nexus, and won tons from that as well.
idk, but it's nice that you have an opinion

when u personally go out of ur way to die tons and suicide bomb towers, end up taking a majority of towers in game, gets C- (not aram, just a general point about what your saying about going after nexus)

I'll surrender if my team has a troll (intentional feeding, etc), but usually fight it out, even if it's a lost cause.
Also surrender if more than one AFK, in a situation where they never joined the game, not if they got DC'd and may be back.
I've won a fair few 4v5's in ARAM (as the 4), but never a 3v5. This is with almost 5k games of ARAM played.

Sometimes enemy teams just farm and bm the whole way and creates a really unfun environment, i dont mind losing, just no need to draw it out and be a salty bm in the process. Sometimes match ups are so uneven in champs there's no point.
If the enemy team has about 4x the kills of my team, that's about the point which I would surrender. Otherwise, I'd probably stick with it.
